Sitewise Analytics is a recognized, boutique, customer-centric company that has been on the North American commercial real estate scene providing predictive analytics software and solutions since 2012. Industry-leading corporations and franchisors partner with Sitewise Analytics to work out varied business questions from sales forecasting and sales impact assessment, to portfolio optimization and whitespace analysis. Clients include Burger King, Wingstop, Lululemon, The North Face, Aspen Dental, Banfield Pet Hospitals and many other organizations in the restaurant, retail and healthcare sectors.This role will be based at Sitewise Analytics’ office in Plano, TX, along with other members of the Predictive Analytics Team. The Team uses a hybrid model of working from home and at the office. The company’s owners intentionally facilitate an extraordinary environment that engages employees to stretch, grow and deliver outstanding business support services to customers. At the heart of Sitewise Analytics is a nimble, diverse, motivated and passionate Predictive Analytics Team. The members of the team interact directly with decision-makers at several levels within client companies. Using a dynamic mix of machine learning approaches blended with classical statistical techniques and spatial analytics, the members of the team develop predictive models and provide strategic advice to decision-makers in customer organizations. As a result of successful growth, the Sitewise Analytics Team is delightfully expanding to include another Senior Predictive Modeler.Using our proprietary modeling processes and Sitewise Pro technology platform, the Senior Predictive Modeler has a mandate to help customers solve complex business challenges. Fundamental to the role is the responsibility to be proactive and curious, to listen deeply to stated and unstated client needs and to develop and implement custom models to address those needs in thoughtful, impactful and explainable ways. The Senior Predictive Modeler will report to the Director of Analytics Operations and work closely with leaders and executives within customer organizations.The ideal candidate for the role of Senior Predictive Modeler is a calm, creative model builder with superb listening, analytical, organizational, Excel, computer and problem-solving skills. The candidate must have a minimum of three years of relevant business experience, with a proven track record of building statistically sound and interpretable sales forecasting models. The candidate must possess the ability to successfully manage multiple projects, on time, and to work effectively with detail, without losing sight of the big picture. The candidate must a have genuine desire and proven capacity to work directly with clients and a deep commitment to ensuring that services are delivered consistently and in accordance with Sitewise’s internal best practice standards. The candidate must have completed a master-level degree in a relevant discipline such as data science or econometrics. Able to work independently and with minimal supervision, the candidate must be a results-oriented team player who can contribute positively in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities.Preferred qualifications include experience in machine learning algorithms, including KNN, Random Forest, K-Means Clustering, as well as working knowledge of Alteryx, Python/R. It would be an asset to have experience or prior exposure to market research and retail analytics.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: From $90,000.00 per yearBenefits:Flexible scheduleHealth insurancePaid time offSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayNo weekendsSupplemental pay types:Bonus payAbility to commute/relocate:Dallas, TX: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)Experience:analytics: 3 years (Required)Work Location: In person

Battelle delivers when others can’t. We conduct research and development, manage national laboratories, design and manufacture products and deliver critical services for our clients—whether they are a multi-national corporation, a small start-up or a government agency.
We recognize and appreciate the value and contributions of individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences and welcome all qualified individuals to apply.
Job Summary

Battelle’s Trust and Assurance Cyber Analytics Department is seeking Mid-Level Data Scientists to work in our Columbus, Ohio location.
“From Silicon to Systems” - We are an elite, multi-disciplinary team, bringing together the brightest minds from physics, computer science, electrical engineering, and mathematics to develop unique embedded security solutions for government and industrial customers.
Battelle has been trusted by elite government clients to solve some of the world’s hardest security problems. We work in small agile teams to push the bounds of computing technology. Our high-powered labs include specialized software and hardware, so our engineers have everything they need to invent new Cyber solutions.
Our team is casual putting results over formality. Team members can work flexible hours, and Battelle maintains a 9/80 schedule meaning employees have a chance to take every other Friday off.
We encourage new ideas with our large Internal Research and Development (IRAD) program where engineers work on projects they are passionate about. Inventors and innovators are rewarded by our industry leading IP compensation program. Our group works collaboratively with many parts of Battelle’s larger organization on projects ranging from genomics to robotics.
Responsibilities
Aid in the design and implementation of machine learning, data mining, data fusion, and data engineering techniques applied to cyber security problems
Learn and become fluent in the details of security related domains in order to devise data driven solutions – this can range from software fuzzing to micro-electronic supply chain analysis
Improve existing techniques and devise new techniques to solve security data problems
Independently propose and develop creative solutions to unique problems, potentially leading IR&D projects
Identify and articulate strengths and weaknesses of solutions, conclusions and problem approaches during technical discussions.

Key Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in STEM field (Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, or similar) with 5 years’ experience, Master’s degree in related field with 2 years’ experience, or PhD with 2 years experience, or equivalent related work experience
Demonstrated experience developing in either Python or R.
Experience solving complex data problems
Experience applying machine learning, statistics and/or data mining techniques
Excitement about learning new technical subject areas and curiosity about cyber security problems
Must be a sole U.S. Citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a US government security clearance.

Preferred Qualifications
Advanced degree in STEM field (Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, or similar) or related work experience
Experience with deep learning methods and with microelectronic design workflow
Electronics bench skills such as digital and analog test & measurement
Ability to generate verification test benches for simulating and validating microelectronic designs
Experience in vulnerability analysis for either software or hardware
Understanding of VHDL and/or Verilog hardware description languages.
Familiarity with compiled languages like C, C++, or rust
Familiarity with shell scripting languages like bash, zsh, or csh
Active Secret or Top-Secret Clearance
Benefits: Live an Extraordinary Life
We care about your well-being, not just on the job. Battelle offers comprehensive and competitive benefits to help you live your best life.
Balance life through a compressed work schedule: Most of our team follows a flexible, compressed work schedule that allows for every other Friday off—giving you a dedicated day to accomplish things in your personal life without using vacation time.
Take time to recharge: You get paid time off to support work-life balance and keep motivated.
Prioritize wellness: Stay healthy with medical, dental, and vision coverage with wellness incentives and benefits plus a variety of optional supplemental benefits.
Better together: Coverage for partners, gender-affirming care and health support, and family formation support.
Build your financial future: Build financial stability with an industry-leading 401(k) retirement savings plan. For most employees, we put in 5 percent whether you contribute or not, and match your contributions on top of that.
Advance your education: Tuition assistance is available to pursue higher education.
Flexible work arrangements: You have options for where you work and when you work.

A Work Environment Where You Succeed
For brilliant minds in science, technology, engineering and business operations, Battelle is the place to do the greatest good by solving humanity’s most pressing challenges and creating a safer, healthier and more secure world.

You will have the opportunity to thrive in a culture that inspires you to:
Apply your talent to challenging and meaningful projects
Receive select funding to pursue ideas in scientific and technological discovery
Collaborate with world-class experts in an inclusive environment
Nurture and develop the next generation of scientific leaders
Give back to and improve our communities

Job Title: AI and ML Research and Development Technologist, Lead
Job Description:
The Opportunity:
As an experienced engineer, you know that machine learning is critical to understanding and processing massive datasets. Your ability to conduct statistical analyses on business processes using ML techniques makes you an integral part of delivering a customer-focused solution. We need your technical knowledge and desire to problem-solve to support clients.
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) research and development (R&D) Lead Technologist with a background in integrating AI and ML into the framework of Intelligent Autonomous Systems (IAS). The ideal candidate will help build and lead an R&D team in developing and integrating cutting-edge AI and ML technologies into autonomous systems. In this role, you will be responsible for leading the design and development of advanced algorithms and software solutions that enable the effective operation of trusted autonomous systems. You will conduct experiments to explore new AI and ML technologies and collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, system engineers, and product managers to ensure the successful integration of these technologies into the IAS development pipeline. You will also help develop Test, Evaluation, Verification and Validation (TEV&V) procedures and techniques for IAS.
Work with us to solve real-world challenges and define ML strategy for our key DoD clients.
Join us. The world can’t wait.
You Have:
8+ years of experience in AI and ML research and development, with a focus on autonomous systems
Experience in machine learning, computer vision, and deep learning algorithms
Experience with leading a team of AI and ML engineers, researchers, and data scientists to develop and deploy advanced AI and ML technologies in autonomous systems
Experience with developing innovative ML models and algorithms and solutions to improve the performance of IAS
Experience with programming languages, including Python, C++, or Java
Ability to present research findings and recommendations to clients and executive leadership
Ability to build collaboration partnerships with industry and academic institutions
Ability to stay current with the latest developments in AI/ML technologies and autonomous systems technologies, to identify opportunities for innovation
Ability to obtain a security clearance
Master's degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering
Nice If You Have:
Experience with DevOps tooling, pipelines, and building containerized applications to run in a Kubernetes environment
Experience with CI/CD principles, methodologies, and tools, including GitLab CI/CD and Jenkins
Experience with distributed data and computing tools, including Spark, Databricks, Hadoop, Hive, AWS EMR, or Kafka
Possession of strong communication and leadership skills
Possession of strong R&D proposal writing and organization skills
Secret clearance
Doctorate degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering
Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

25 Amica Way, Lincoln, RI 02865

Your future is our business.

Experience leading predictive modeling projects involving new rating structures

Excellent communication and presentation skills, including storytelling and other methods to guide, inspire, and provide insights to non-technical stakeholders
Intellectual curiosity, and drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques

ES216 Data Scientist
NASA is more than astronauts. We are scientists, engineers, IT specialists, human resources specialists, accountants, writers, technicians, and many other kinds of people working together to break barriers to achieve the seemingly impossible.
We continue NASA’s legacy of excellence through an unprecedented array of missions—from laying the foundation to expand our human presence in deep space to developing cutting-edge technologies to studying Earth’s system. We tackle each adventure with curiosity and innovation to leave an enduring impact on the world and humanity.
Align your talents with your passion and find out why NASA has been named a best place to work” in the federal government for ten years in a row. At NASA, you’ll have an opportunity to work on unique and challenging projects that truly make an impact on humanity.
We are seeking a Data Scientist to join an exciting on-orbit NASA mission. The ICE, Cloud, and Land Elevation, Satellite (ICESat-2) Mission is a laser altimeter with a single instrument, the Advanced Topographic Laser Altimeter System (ATLAS) which was launched on September 15, 2018. ICESat-2 makes height measurements globally, over sea ice covered regions these height measurements are converted to freeboard and thickness using a suite of algorithms developed by the project. ICESat-2 is expected to create a decadal-scale time series of sea ice change extending back to the launch of ICESat in 2003 and which makes use of other satellite and airborne missions after the failure of ICESat in 2009. This task provides for the continued evaluation of data required to produce this time series from ICESat-2 and refinement of the products. Primary work will be done using Python with utilization or conversion of some heritage code written in Matlab and IDL. All code is expected to be integrated into an existing Github environment for shared work across the group of researchers working on the products. This position reports to the Prime Contractor Earth Science Group Manager for the SESDA Contract. This position is located in Greenbelt, MD.
The successful candidate will support the on-orbit evaluation, development, and visualization of ICESat-2 sea ice data products. These products are the retrieved surface elevation, surface type identification, and freeboard from the ATL07 and ATL10 data products (and associated ATL20 and ATL21 gridded products) as well as a NASA Goddard sea ice thickness research product. This task will also support the assessments towards the evaluation and further development of ICESat-2 data in conjunction with other satellite and airborne data sets such as CryoSat-2 and other project directed airborne campaigns. Specifically, the successful candidate will:
Support assessments of the ATL07/10 along-track and ATL20/21 gridded data products. This will be done through the development of new data visualization tools such as mapping and plotting routines which explore different temporal and spatial aspects of the data. Comparisons of ATL07/10 data with airborne laser altimetry and imagery will also be done using heritage retrieval algorithms and will also support the evaluation of new algorithm approaches.
Help develop and provide support for GSFC sea ice thickness products. This work includes the development of new visualization tools for the data set, testing of new algorithm approaches, development, and maintenance of scripts for the automated daily generation of the sea ice thickness product, and incorporation of new routines as needed to the master Python code used to generate the sea ice thickness data set. Data will be reprocessed as required.
Support comparisons of the ICESat-2 elevation, freeboard, and thickness data products with satellite and in-situ data products including CryoSat-2, undersea mooring data, and EM bird measurements. Tasks for this will include the utilization of heritage IDL and Matlab code for the processing of the satellite and in-situ data products.
Required Experience:
At least three years’ experience in scientific programming is required. This includes use of Python specifically as well as integration into an existing Github environment.
At least three years’ experience with scientific data processing code development.
At least three years’ experience with science data product development and product validation.
Successful experience with algorithm and/or code issue resolution.
Self-initiated individual, with a history of meeting schedules and technical goals.

Job Summary :

Designs, develops and programs methods, processes, and systems to consolidate and analyze unstructured, diverse “big data” sources to generate actionable insights and solutions for client services and product enhancement. Utilizes statistical modeling to make predictions about future outcomes and in multiple scenarios. Evangelizes new ideas / technologies / solutions to gain acceptance from a wide range of audiences.Assigned to the most complex projects.

Job Responsibilities :
Utilizes statistical modeling to make predictions about future outcomes and in multiple scenarios. Evangelizes new ideas / technologies / solutions to gain acceptance at the highest levels of the organization.

Analyses have the highest level of impact on business operations or outcomes.

About Walgreens and WBA :

Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170 year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nation’s medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high quality products and services in communities nationwide.

Job Description:

We are currently hiring a Senior Data Scientist to help grow our company and ensure our mission is achieved!
This position is eligible for remote work with some days in the office in our Draper, Utah location. Candidate must live within a 60-mile radius of Draper, Utah.
WE ARE: A team of hungry entrepreneurs with big dreams, gritty FinTech experts, passionate about disrupting big markets, joined on a mission to modernize and accelerate our technical environment. We like to move quickly, break things, make mistakes, and get better every day, as long as we are continuously delivering.
YOU ARE: A driven analytics professional. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will blend analytics, data mining, machine learning, and software engineering to build solutions that will result in massive improvements to the way we do business. You will be responsible for developing and improving key decision systems and predictive models to drive maximum business impact. You will develop a profound understanding of our customers, business processes, products, and financials by studying the data that describe each of these elements of our business. You will be at the forefront of this rapidly evolving field and have the opportunity to develop your own tools and technologies as you do. Most importantly, you’ll be part of a team that forms the backbone of a fast-growing company at the forefront of an exciting, growing industry.
YOUR DAY-TO-DAY:
Deliver innovative enhancements to a portfolio of products with high impact both to the company’s financial success and to the lives of our customers
Build, maintain, and improve decision systems and predictive models that are key to our competitive advantage
Explore new data sources both internal and external and use findings to further improve and optimize model performance
Design, implement, and read in-market experiments testing new algorithms, technologies, and processes to better serve our customer and stay ahead of the competition
Recommend and support strategic business changes through rigorous analytics, deep understanding of the business, and creative problem solving
Identify, evaluate, and help implement emerging advanced analytics technologies and methods
Be part of a collegial, fast-growing team of like-minded data scientists who work and play together, and who love what they do and where they do it!
YOU'LL BRING:
Master’s degree in a quantitative or technical field (Math, Statistics, Engineering, Economics, Physics, Computer Science, etc.)
3+ years work experience with data exploration and machine learning tools such as those found in R or Python
3+ years work experience applying advanced statistical modeling techniques to solve problems
Ability to craft rigorous research / evaluation design approaches, based upon understanding of clients' research needs
Demonstrated ability applying advanced statistical modeling techniques to solve problems
Ability to craft rigorous research / evaluation design approaches, based upon understanding of clients' research needs
Track record of achieving business results through creative problem solving and careful implementation
YOU MIGHT ALSO HAVE:
Advanced knowledge and experience with querying languages (SQL, etc.)
Understanding of modern software development and engineering practices including scrum/agile, Git, and DevOps
WE OFFER:
Competitive Compensation
Eligibility for quarterly bonuses
Full Health Benefits: Medical/Dental/Vision
Life Insurance
Paid Parental Leave
Company Matched 401k
Paid Time Off + Paid Holidays
Employee Stock Purchase Program
Tuition Reimbursement
Charitable Gift Matching
And more!
WHO WE ARE
SInce 1983, Vive Financial has offered a line of credit serving prime and near-prime consumers. Our mission is to create a better today and unlock the possibilities of tomorrow through financial empowerment. We provide flexible and affordable payment options for various goods and services including: medical procedures, furniture, retail, home improvement and more!
Vive Financial does not discriminate in any aspect of employment on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, age, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local employment discrimination laws where Vive Financial does business. All new hires must pass a pre-employment criminal background check and drug test.

Role: Responsible for supporting the strategic data initiatives that drive business profitability, insight, increased efficiencies and improved customer experience. The ideal candidate is adept at using a variety of data assets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing solutions, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes. Responsibilities Lead the Information Technology research, design and implementation of data analysis and reporting solutions to support business strategies across all functional areas. Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging data to drive business solutions. Architect, implement, and monitor data pipelines, as well as conduct knowledge sharing sessions with peers to ensure effective data use. Extract data from multiple sources, using machine learning tools to organize data, process, clean, and validate the data. Enhancing data collection procedures to include all relevant information for developing analytic systems. Applies analytical rigor and statistical methods to analyze large amounts of data, using advanced statistical techniques such as predictive statistical models, customer profiling, segmentation analysis, and data mining to support business strategies. Create data visualizations and presentations to communicate findings to non-technical stakeholders to assist with strategic decision making. Assess the Information Technology effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques. Discover trends and patterns and present data using various data visualization techniques and tools. Work with Information Technology team members and business leaders to investigate technologies and tools for developing innovative solutions to increase automation, increased efficiency, and improved decision making. Stay up to date with the latest trends and best practices in data analysis and machine learning Perform other duties as assigned. Expectations: Collaborate with stakeholders and understand key business priorities and challenges to design the right actionable data and analytics solution to address needs. Communicate complex data in a simple, actionable way. Analyze and interpret large and complex data sets to assist stakeholders throughout the organization distill insights; connect disparate insights into cohesive, well-grounded recommendations. Assist stakeholders throughout the organization apply predictive modeling techniques to optimize the forecasts for planning needs. Assist stakeholders in presenting data findings and insights across most levels of leadership in a compelling way that facilitates discussion and lead to decisions. Program and write maintainable and well-documented scripts/applications for process automation; produce reusable models. Leverage programming skills to develop automated solutions that help improve business operations. Socialize the importance of data governance and ethics and ensure consistency around data quality through process improvements. Work closely with Information Technology Business Technology teams to maintain technologies, manage code within repositories, maintain appropriate documentation of solutions, perform testing to ensure accuracy of results, maintain governance processes, and continuously mature processes to align with industry best practices. Work closely with Internal Audit, Enterprise Risk Management, and cross functional business departments to ensure consistent application of practices across the company. Ability to work independently and with team members from different backgrounds to proactively evaluate data from wide variety of sources, make predictions, and identify potential business opportunities. Continuous commitment to education and awareness of industry best practice solutions for data analysis and automation. Protect business records created or used in business processes to ensure availability, confidentiality, integrity; and the retention and destruction as specified by relevant policies. Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously, ability to solve problems, memory for details, ability to prioritize, and ability to maintain concentrated mental and visual attention for sustained periods. Demonstrate a commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI). Provides reporting to the Office of Minority and Women Inclusion (OMWI), as needed, as well as partners with OMWI to implement effective policies and procedures that incorporate DEI into business activities. Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Analytics, Statistics, or related field. Interpersonal Skills: The ability to motivate or influence others is a material part of the job, requiring a significant level of diplomacy and trust. Obtaining cooperation (internally and/or externally) is an important part of the job. Other Skills: Five to seven years of experience transforming and analyzing data from multiple sources to drive business insights Seven plus years of experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.) Knowledge and experience with data science toolkits such as Matplotlib, Pandas, NumPy, and GitHub Two to five years of experience with visualization tools and data spreadsheets, including Cognos, Power BI and Excel Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques, algorithms, and their real-world advantages/drawbacks Advanced Theory and practical knowledge of statistical techniques and concepts and experience with applications. Proven ability to perform with a high degree of accuracy and detail orientation Proven ability to deliver presentations to stakeholders that tell a compelling story using analytics relevant to the audience. ID13-G

The Challenge:
For an organization to transform in today’s digital world, it needs to properly collect, store, and organize its data. Effective data management can enable more efficient operations, yielding more growth. As a data architect, you know how to apply your creative-thinking and analytical mindset to help organizations manage their data assets. We’re looking for an experienced data architect like you to deliver leading-edge solutions for an Air Command's Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) mission.
As a data architect, you’ll use your extensive technical expertise to design data architectures to support data science, data engineering, and data visualization. You’ll resolve routine data architecture issues in collaboration with technical teams by providing advice on data warehousing or data mesh methods and approaches, analyzing data architecture business needs, and working with project staff to make decisions and recommendations on future data architecture developments. You will apply a wide range of Big Data and Cloud technologies to propose recommendations for the development of data integration pipelines, scalable data storage environments, Application Programming interfaces (APIs), security procedures, and algorithms used to deliver data faster and more accurately to decision-makers. Along with your team, you will analyze the needs and the environment to ensure development considers the architecture and operating environment as well as future functionality and enhancements. Define and maintain canonical data elements and definitions, data models, policies and business rules, constraints using regular expressions, and reference datasets. You'll develop plans for implementing an enterprise data catalog to identify data quality and data lineage.
This team will deliver world class solutions to implement Artificial Intelligence, Automation and data Augmentation (AAA) and cloud strategy across the ISR enterprise by modernizing the digital environment to meet the requirements of Joint All Domain Command and Control (JADC2), Advance Battle Management System (ABMS), the Sensing Grid, Agile Combat Employment (ACE), the Intelligence Community’s (IC) Augmenting Intelligence with Machines (AIM), Information Environment, and Information Technology Environment strategies.
You’ll also provide mentoring and training for our mission partners, educating them about data architecture, data science, data engineering, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. Your advanced consulting skills and extensive technical expertise will guide clients as they navigate the landscape of data, algorithms, tools, and frameworks. With your drive to establish processes and lead technological innovation, you’ll make a lasting impact on the ISR mission.
Join us. The world can’t wait.
You Have:
3+ years of experience with data architecture, data warehousing, and data governance
3+ years of experience leading business process reengineering, business process assessment, or business architectural development
3+ years of experience developing highly responsive data structures, metadata capture strategies, ontologies, and data dictionaries
3+ years of experience leading data operations teams to develop architecture or extract-transform-load (ETL) data pipelines
3+ years of experience managing an enterprise data catalog for a large organization
Experience with cloud technology supporting scalable data solutions
Knowledge of database development and administration, including process and software
Ability to obtain a security clearance
Bachelor's degree

Experience working on multi-disciplinary Agile teams
Experience working with the Air Force
Knowledge of DoD enterprise data and systems
Knowledge of ISR capabilities, including sensing effects across multiple domains and how these effects can be leveraged in GEOINT, SIGINT, and MASINT sensed environments

Who we are
American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading global insurance organization. AIG member companies provide a wide range of property casualty insurance in approximately 70 countries and jurisdictions. These diverse offerings include products and services that help businesses and individuals protect their assets and manage risks.
We’re also committed to making a positive difference for our colleagues and in the communities where we work and live. We encourage colleagues to give back to the causes they care most about, supporting these efforts through our Volunteer Time Off and Matching Grants Programs.
Get to know the business
General Insurance is a leading provider of insurance products and services for commercial and personal insurance customers. It includes one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. General Insurance offers a broad range of products to customers through a diversified, multichannel distribution network.
About the role
The Cyber Portfolio Analytics team delivers data-driven analytics and insights to AIG’s Cyber business leaders. The team supports critical business decisions including underwriting strategy / market positioning, risk appetite and limit setting, capital allocation, portfolio risk management (including catastrophe and clash) and reinsurance / risk transfer.
The team is seeking a Cyber Insurance Data Scientist to build the next generation of AIG’s Cyber Underwriting Model and develop advanced analytics to drive business strategy. The ideal candidate will have deep technical expertise modeling insurance risk, and be highly analytical, collaborative, strategic and a forward-thinker. The candidate will partner with Cyber Security and Cyber Insurance Data Analytics Leads to build an industry-leading analytics platform to drive underwriting at transactional and portfolio levels.
Position Responsibilities:
Serve as the team’s lead technical expert and build analytics and predictive models to drive cyber insurance underwriting decisions. With the Head of Cyber Portfolio Analytics, translate model output into actionable, data-driven underwriting strategies; present findings and recommendations to Cyber Product Leadership to drive cyber underwriting strategy. Lead the technical design, modeling methodology and coding of AIG’s account-level, underwriting risk model; review technical details, test model accuracy and update to reflect the latest trends and threat environment. Work closely with the team’s Cyber Security Data Analytics Lead to assess the quality / lift of external data sets for use in predictive modeling.
Position Requirements:
Mid-level experience in general insurance (preferably Cyber insurance) with focus on building predictive analytics and underwriting models.
Strong expertise in the full model development process – from data wrangling, to data matching, ETL, model building, testing and deployment; highly proficient at coding in one or more languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL, Spark); adept at using data visualization techniques (e.g., R Shiny, Tableau) for exploratory data analysis.
Deep / thorough command of data science and advanced analytics methods (e.g., supervised and unsupervised machine learning) to measure cyber security risk.
Experience working cross-functionally with operations and information technology (IT) to move analytical models from development into a production environment.
Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or university; Masters degree is strongly preferred. Technical education in a quantitative field (e.g., Actuarial Science, Analytics, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics, etc.).
Demonstrated ability to work across interdisciplinary teams to enhance risk-based decision making.
Strong communication skills (oral and written) and unique ability to translate data and technical insights into logical and compelling business recommendations.
Strong ability to identify, analyze and solve problems as well as the ability to learn rapidly, adapt quickly to change, exercise influence, and manage and prioritize multiple concurrent projects.
For positions based in New York City, the base salary range is $115,000-$170,000 and the position is eligible for a bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable incentive plan. In addition, we’re proud to offer a range of competitive benefits, a summary of which can be viewed here: Benefits Overview.

The Opportunity:
Ever-expanding technology like IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence means that there’s more structured and unstructured data available today than ever before. As a data engineer, you know that organizing big data can yield pivotal insights when it’s gathered from disparate sources. We need a big data experienced professional like you to help our clients find answers in their data to impact important missions from fraud detection to cancer research, to national intelligence.
As a lead big data engineer at Booz Allen, you’ll use your expertise to lead data engineering activities on some of the most mission-driven projects in the industry. You’ll oversee the development and deployment of pipelines and platforms that organize and make disparate data meaningful. Here, you’ll guide and mentor a multi-disciplinary team of analysts, data engineers, developers, and data consumers in a fast-paced, agile environment. You’ll use your expertise in analytical exploration and data examination while you oversee the assessment, design, building, and maintenance of scalable platforms for your clients. Work with us to use big data for good.
Join us. The world can’t wait.

Job Description
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Boeing Defense Space & Security (BDS) has an exciting opportunity and immediate need on the P-8 Air Vehicle Program for a Lead Engineering Data Scientist in Tukwila, WA.

This role will be a part of the Air Vehicle Engineering team providing support to the E-7 and P-8 program. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to develop cutting edge tools for multiple programs across the division. This person will be responsible to lead cross-functional teams to determine, define and deploy sophisticated descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, or prescriptive analytic solutions integral to the development, evaluation and production for E-7 and P-8. The role will require the evaluation of stakeholder needs and choosing the best fit methods, defines algorithms, validates and deploys models, while performing the vital data preparation and improvements to models.

Position Key Responsibilities:
Create Maps for all digital data sources and data bases

Investigate and learn about information data sources capabilities and access

Build Indicators Dashboards with the support from engineering management

Identify sources of data to construct predictive and prescriptive models.

Construct predictive and prescriptive models for the engineering community within the P-8 program.

This position is hybrid. This means that the selected candidate will be required to perform some work onsite at one of the listed location options. This is at the hiring team’s discretion and could potentially change in the future.

Basic Qualifications:
Advanced technical education from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor)

1+ years or more of knowledge and experience in data analysis algorithms (e.g. data mining, statistics, machine learning, natural language processing, text mining, visual analytics) and building Descriptive, Predictive and Prescriptive models

1+ years or more designing and creating new algorithms for the analysis of data to address project requirements, evaluate performance of data analysis algorithms and select and apply algorithms to meet application requirements

1+ years or more applying knowledge of 2D and/or 3D computer graphics to generate data representation and to communicate information

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in product production environment

Knowledge of multiple information technology areas

Systems thinking skills, the ability to understand the big picture and the inter-relationships of all positions and activities in the system, including the impact of changes in one area on another area

Experience communicating to program leadership

Typical Education & Experience:
Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 9 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. PhD+4 years' related work experience, Master+7 years' related work experience). In the USA, ABET accreditation is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard.

Relocation:
This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.

Drug Free Workplace:
Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.

Shift:

Job Summary :

Designs, develops and programs methods, processes, and systems to consolidate and analyze unstructured, diverse “big data” sources to generate actionable insights and solutions for client services and product enhancement. Utilizes statistical modeling to make predictions about future outcomes and in multiple scenarios. Evangelizes new ideas / technologies / solutions to gain acceptance from a wide range of audiences. Assigned to the most complex projects.

Utilizes statistical modeling to make predictions about future outcomes and in multiple scenarios. Evangelizes new ideas / technologies / solutions to gain acceptance at the highest levels of the organization.
Interprets and applies data in the most strategic, most complex analyses, and explains findings to the stakeholders and business audiences to improve products and processes.
Sets the vision for manipulation and analysis of large and complex data sets.
Leads the development and execution of statistical and mathematical analyses to support business decisions enterprise wide or for multiple business functions.
Analyses have the highest level of impact on business operations or outcomes.
Leads the design and development of strategic and highly complex algorithms and statistical predictive models and determines analytical approaches and modeling techniques to evaluate scenarios and potential future outcomes.

IInteracts with product and service teams to identify questions and issues for data analysis and experiments. interprets and communicates insights and findings from analysis and experiments to product, service, and business managers.

About Walgreens and WBA :

Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170 year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nation’s medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high quality products and services in communities nationwide.

Senior Statistician
Who We Are: With Farm Bureau Financial Services, our client/members can feel confident knowing their family, home, cars and other property are protected. We value a culture where integrity, teamwork, passion, service, leadership and accountability are at the heart of every decision we make and every action we take. We're proud of our more than 80-year commitment to protecting the livelihoods and futures of our client/members and creating an atmosphere where our employees thrive.
What You'll Do: As a Senior Statistician you will ensure accuracy, timeliness and validity of bureau reporting and serve as data quality analyst. You will:
Respond to and resolve customer service request according to FBL Financial Group, Inc., policies in a prompt, efficient and courteous manner.
Review and analyze statistical calls, edit listings, and error reports to be sure the requested date is within acceptable standards of accuracy and timeliness as established by bureaus to minimize or avoid monetary penalties.
Assure the accuracy and availability of statistical date by serving as liaison between statistical reporting agencies and company departments.
Participate in industry advisory functions and be proactive concerning statistical reporting as it impacts expenses and our companies.
Assist with determining and consult on the implementation of procedural or system changes by reviewing all requests and bulletins received from bureaus.
Specify system modification requirements and assist with testing and implementation of application systems to make sure changes are they relate to statistical reporting are implemented.
What It Takes to Join Our Team:
College degree or equivalent required (course work in math and computer science preferred), and two years of relevant experience required.
Willing to learn basic mainframe computer knowledge including JCL, TSO, and query language programming.
Require one of IIA, AU, AAM or equivalent.
Able to analyze and resolve problems.
What We Offer You: When you're on our team, you get more than a great paycheck. You'll hear about career development and educational opportunities. We offer an enhanced 401K with a match, low-cost health, dental, and vision benefits, and life and disability insurance options. We also offer paid time off, including holidays and volunteer time, and teams who know how to have fun. Add to that an onsite wellness facility with fitness classes and programs, a daycare center, a cafeteria, and for many positions, even consideration for a hybrid work arrangement. Farm Bureau....where the grass really IS greener!
Work Authorization/Sponsorship
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. We are not able to sponsor now or in the future, or take over sponsorship of, an employment visa or work authorization for this role. For example, we are not able to sponsor OPT status.

Deliver insights to help our clients turn data into action as a Data Scientist at GDIT. Your work will provide transformative solutions to our clients' big-data obstacles and help advance the mission. Here, you can make a meaningful impact on our clients' mission and on your career.

At GDIT, people are our differentiator. As a Data Scientist you will help ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. Our work depends on TS/SCI cleared Data Scientist joining our team to support our intelligence customer in St. Louis, MO.

HOW A DATA SCIENTIST WILL MAKE AN IMPACT

This position supports the Geospatial Services & Solutions business area to provide high-quality, cost-effective solutions to the customer. As part of the GSS Team the Data Scientist's expertise is needed to support a sophisticated enterprise environment.

The Scientist is an active participant in SAFe and Scrum development teams and meetings.

SPECIFIC DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Identify data sources and automate collection processes
Perform preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large, complex data sets to identify trends and patterns

Present information using data visualization techniques

Collaborate with engineering and product development teams
WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO SUCCEED:

2+ years of experience as a Data Scientist, Data Engineer, ML Engineer, or Data Analysts and Bachelor's Degree in Computer Programming, Science, Engineering or a related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical training, or work/military experience
3+ years of experience in a Linux environment
Direct experience and demonstrated proficiency with Python programming to build containerized microservices that use message queues such as activemq or rabbitmq.
Experienced in ML Model performance testing and hyperparameter tuning (Tensorboard, wandb, mlflow)
Experience training ML models with GPU acceleration in a containerized environment using common AI frameworks such as Tensorflow or Torch.
Experience with workload managers (SLURM, Argo Workflow, Airflow)
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Must possess excellent time management skills and the drive to work unsupervised
Active TS/SCI clearance required and eligibility to obtain a CI poly

Prior experience working with or within the Intelligence Community or a military intelligence unit
Understanding of access management and security groups (i.e. IAM, S3 bucket, SSH, VPN, etc.)
computer vision related experience with torchvision or tensorflow object detection APIs.

Experience building data pipelines with spark, kafka, or nifi

What You Will Do:
Guidehouse is looking for a Data Analyst/Scientist to increase the usability of a security sector client’s data assets and serve as a strategic advisor to the client to advance data analysis, governance, and management. He/she will supervise one data specialist and will be responsible for identifying when surge data specialists are needed, acclimating them to tasks, and supervising their performance.
The ideal candidate will speak the language of business and technical teams and act as the bridge between technical team members and non-technical team members and stakeholders. He/she will possess a thorough understanding of business and data strategy; have experience mentoring and managing junior resources; be able to oversee the collection, storage, management, quality, and protection of data; and, will have an ability to communicate the status, value, and importance of data analytics and management to project team members and senior clients.
The Data Analyst/Scientist will be responsible for:
Developing sustainable and reproducible data management and governance processes
Promoting the use of data insights and analytics to enrich business decision-making and key business initiatives, including developing and refining Tableau dashboards and other visualizations for key client stakeholders
Guiding data infrastructure development, deployment, and maintenance to accelerate data informed decision making
Reviewing presentations, graphs and other visualizations, and tables to ensure accuracy and quality
Maintaining data management plans and instructions for operating complex business systems
Ensuring data and information security by integrating and upholding digital security standards
Understanding the client’s organization and culture to improve data governance and management, analytics maturity, and advanced analytics capabilities
Serving as a strategic thought partner to guide business decisions and provide input to data strategies and metrics
Piloting ways to leverage emerging and disruptive capabilities including machine learning, natural language processing, robotics/automation, etc.
What You Will Need:
An ACTIVE and CURRENT SECRET federal security clearance
FIVE (5) years of relevant experience
Bachelor's degree
What Would Be Nice To Have:
5+ years of expertise across multiple areas such as: data science, data management, data governance, data strategy, data wrangling (structured/unstructured, real-time/streaming data, external and non-traditional data sources), and data visualization
1+ years of project, product, or program management
Proficiency in R/Python or other scripting languages
Proficiency in Tableau
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts and insights to senior business leaders and partners in a relevant and actionable manner in writing and verbally
Teamwork and collaboration mindset, interpersonal and relationship-building skills, and ability to lead by influence and example
Demonstrated thought leadership on complex problems with examples of implementing innovative data science solutions and driving outstanding results
Experience with SQL Server and/or Azure
Experience with Salesforce

Job Description
General Summary:
The Data Strategy & Solutions team is seeking an experienced data scientist to develop a "next best action" (NBA) platform for our field team to help them get medicines to our patients. The successful candidate will work closely with our data product and engineering teams to build cutting-edge recommendation engines that leverage advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to deliver personalized recommendations to our field team.
Key Duties and Responsibilities:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements, data sources, and data quality requirements.
Design, develop and implement next best action recommendation engines using data science and machine learning techniques.
Collaborate with data engineering team to build and optimize data pipelines that feed data into the recommendation engines.
Develop A/B testing and performance metrics to measure the effectiveness of the recommendation engines and drive personalized recommendations.
Communicate insights and results to stakeholders through clear and concise presentations.
Required Knowledge and Skills:
At least two years of experience as a Data Scientist, with a focus on building recommendation engines.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL.
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms and statistical modeling techniques.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Education:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Preferred Education and Experience:
PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field.
Experience working with recommendation systems in the e-commerce, retail, biopharma, or healthcare industries.
Experience with NLP and reinforcement learning.
Experience with cloud data environments like AWS, Snowflake, Databricks etc.

ABOUT SHEETZ
Sheetz, Inc. is a fast-growing, family-owned, food/convenience company that has been in business since 1952. Sheetz has over 600 locations in Pennsylvania, Ohio, Virginia, West Virginia, Maryland and North Carolina.

Our mission at Sheetz has been to meet the needs of customers on the go. Of course, things have changed over those nearly 70 years. One thing that hasn't changed is our commitment to our customers, our employees and the communities in which we operate. Sheetz donates millions of dollars every year to the charities it holds dear.

Description
We are looking for a Data Scientist with an entrepreneur’s mindset to support a fast-paced and growing data science team working on projects critical to National Security. The position is located within a classified space in Chantilly, VA or Aurora, CO and requires an active TS/SCI with Polygraph security clearance. Position is funded and an immediate fill opportunity. The Data Scientist will be responsible for researching, manipulating, and interpreting complex data and analyze results using machine learning, advanced statistics, and other techniques to draw inferences and clearly articulate findings. The position requires a candidate with demonstrated verbal and written communication skills, dexterity to stay abreast with new developments in data science and statistical modeling, and the ability to obtain the required security clearance. The ideal candidate is highly motivated, technically inquisitive, possess strong problem-solving proficiency, and is a clear communicator. The Data Scientist will be expected to learn and leverage emerging technologies including AWS and Git.
Primary Responsibilities
Perform analysis to solve problems; translate problems into data science questions and develop solutions
Clean, process, prepare, and maintain data sets for analysis and modeling
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify relevant patterns and trends
Develop, evaluate, validate, and implement statistical models and data science methods such as regression, classification, clustering, and time series to provide answers and insights on key strategic questions
Share and communicate results to audiences of varying technical ability
Engage and collaborate with cross-functional teams to address technical needs
Basic Qualifications
BS and 4-8 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 2-6 years of prior relevant experience. May possess a Doctorate in technical domain.
Experience with AI/ML.
TS/SCI clearance with ability to obtain polygraph required
Experience working with Python/C++ or R programming languages
Experience with SciPy stack or Tidyverse packages
Experience/ knowledge of computer science concepts, data architecture, and experience/knowledge of statistics
Demonstrated experience using statistical and machine learning techniques
Experience with visualizing data using popular packages including Tableau, ggplot or Matplotlib
Ability to communicate technical findings to non-technical audiences
Proficient with Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Preferred Qualifications
Familiarity with Unix-based operating systems
Aptitude for learning new technologies
Prior SIGINT experience
Familiarity with geolocation techniques

Pay Range $78,000.00 - $120,000.00 - $162,000.00

About Lumen
Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies.
The Role
The Data Scientist is responsible for developing tools to collect, clean, analyze and manage the data used by strategic areas of the business. Employ techniques and theories drawn from mathematics, statistics, from the subdomains of machine learning, classification, cluster analysis, and data mining.
The Main Responsibilities
Clearly communicate methods and conclusions with simple language and innovative visualizations to management and executives.
Work effectively on a team as well as a self-driven individual to do research and develop cutting edge and effective solutions for the business.
Provide expertise in analyzing and visualizing large, complex, and unique data sets.
Create new insights that will drive business growth and profitability in the short and long term.
Deploy analytics code with a continuous integration environment incorporating version control, build servers, and test servers.
Design and implement programs and automation to collect, mash up, process and analyze distributed real-world data.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand complex business problems, build statistical models, and create predictive tools.
Management of analytical projects and assistance in program planning as well as the acquisition, retention and development of data science talent
What We Look For in a Candidate
8+ years related experience.
Degree(s) in Computer Science, Math, Physics, Economics, Operations Research, Statistics or related discipline
Experience with relational and non-relational databases.
Strong experience with tools for managing, analyzing, and visualizing large datasets.
Programming experience with two or more of R, Python, Lisp, Clojure, Scala, Java, Perl, Mathematica and C++.
Past success in extracurricular math/science activities or competitions is highly regarded.
Creativity and persistence in locating, extracting and analyzing all relevant data.
Problem solving versatility: making the best decisions possible given the data quality and time available.
Strong analytical thinking and ability to quickly pick up new methods, tools and programming languages.
Preferred:
Expertise w/ GIT, agile project management tools (Trello, JIRA, Rally, etc), documentation/markup expertise (Markdown, etc)
Strong verbal, written and visualization communication skills relaying data science findings, problems, etc to business users.
Good working knowledge of PL/T-SQL
Expertise w/ econometric and machine learning methods for predictive analytics
Prior expertise w/ price elasticity of demand modeling and mathematical optimization methods
Culture of curiosity and perseverance in the face of messy data and complex business, information systems landscape
Significant experience with the SDLC, in particular as applied to automation of data science pipelines and development of analytic products
Prior experience coaching junior technical team members
Strong background with planning and management of data science projects as well as leading engagement of stakeholders and communication with non-technical SMEs and partners.
Experience with the wireline telecommunications industry, notably common product technologies and marketing thereof

Seize your opportunity to make a personal impact as a Senior Data Scientist supporting The United States Postal Service (USPS) Office of Inspector General (OIG). GDIT is your place to make meaningful contributions to challenging projects and grow a rewarding career.

At GDIT, people are our differentiator. You will help ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. You will have a primary focus on engineer data analytic solutions, including prototyping, proof of concept, and full implementation. Candidates will evaluate, assess, document, and test data security and continuity of operations for systems and programs. There is an expectation that candidates will be experienced in ensuring compatibility between equipment and software, analyzing operation/systems requirements, supporting design reviews, and presenting technical briefings. Best candidates will be capable of supporting all aspects of AI/ML projects along with consulting, development, and implementation activities of ML Ops end-to-end solutions.

HOW A SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST WILL MAKE AN IMPACT

Coordinate with staff and customers to identify business and technical requirements
Produce written documentation and artifacts for all work completed, including the translation of user requirements into technical designs
Assist the agency in the development of programming and visualization solutions
Troubleshoot and provide support on existing projects or application efforts
Understand the concepts supporting relational databases, data warehousing, data governance, data access, data quality and related areas
Skill applying analytical techniques, methods, and processes to business problems demonstrated through a history of accepted modeling and analyses that resulted in meaningful business impact. These include working with unstructured or structured data and converting those data sets using a variety of analyses such as optimization, simulation, classical and spatial statistics, and/or programming languages
Skill using advanced analytic techniques such as machine learning, natural language processing, robotics process automation, artificial intelligence, text and/or data mining, and statistical and mathematical methods
Work as RISC liaison to CIO for server/system issues related to AWS and Azure
Strong writing and documentation skills to capture collection of source data, methodology from business rules, and visualization deployment from a myriad of sources and interactions with various stakeholders
Perform analysis of data for Extraction, Transformation, and Load (ETL) strategies, pattern recognition, and application of analytical tools
Review, analyze, and modify existing products including coding, debugging, testing, and documenting
Provide guidance to coworkers on business and technical issues affecting projects, such as data access, data quality, storage capacity, and analytic tools and software
Assist with training and conference development which may include presentations to large audiences
Ability to facilitate between business owners and end-users who need to communicate with database administrators and traditional IT support staff
Ensure that quality/security guidelines are followed
Strong relational database and querying languages experience
Understand and follow a software development lifecycle (analysis, design, development, coding, testing, debugging, and documenting)

WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO SUCCEED:


Education:

BA/BS in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Analytics, or related field

Certification(s):

Professional Certification(s) in a related field of data science and/or data analytics disciplines (preferred)

Required Experience:

8+ years' experience and skill writing coding languages (such as SQL, Python, R, SAS, and Java Scripts)
3+ years' experience working with projects involving machine learning, natural language processing, robotics process automation, artificial intelligence, text and/or data mining, as well as statistical and mathematical methods
At least 1+ year experience working with AWS or Azure services such as Databricks, Data Factory, and Data Lake

Required Technical Skills:

Expert proficiency in common data science tools, including:
Scripted languages (such as SQL, Python, R, and Java Scripts), Integrated Development Environment and analytics platforms, open-source solutions, commercial off-the shelf tools and hardware-based capabilities to support the data analytic development process and creating models, dashboards, and reports
Knowledge and experience in:
Using advanced analytic techniques such as machine learning, natural language processing, robotics process automation, artificial intelligence, text and/or data mining, and statistical and mathematical methods
Using business intelligence applications and reporting technologies/methodologies including Data Analytics Expressions (DAX), data Mash-up(M), and Microsoft Power Platform (e.g., Power BI, Power Apps, Power Automate, etc.)
AWS or Azure Services, including Databricks, Data Factory, and Data Lake
SAS Visual Analytics, SAS Enterprise Guide, SAS Studio, Office Analytics, and other SAS tools
Knowledge of ODBC connection strings, and other external data source connection protocols
Knowledge of Extraction, Transformation, and Load (ETL) strategies, pattern recognition, and application of analytical tools

Security Clearance Level:

Ability to obtain a Public Trust
The security clearance for this program requires the selected candidate to have resided in the US for the past five years. The selected candidate cannot have left the country for longer than 90 consecutive days and no more than 180 cumulative days

Required Skills and Abilities:

Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Must be able to work effectively in a team environment.

Location:

Primary location in Arlington, VA with a hybrid work schedule (i.e., commuting one day a week or twice in a two-week period)

GDIT IS YOUR PLACE:

401K with company match
Comprehensive health and wellness packages
Internal mobility team dedicated to helping you own your career
Professional growth opportunities including paid education and certifications
Cutting-edge technology you can learn from
Rest and recharge with paid vacation and holidays

Responsibilities:

This is a role is part of a high-impact team delivering critical insights from data to the Sponsor reaching objectives and enabling informed decision making. The Candidate needs to be skilled at gathering, manipulating, and understanding data resources and combines these skills with curiosity and a passion for solving organizational problems. A strong communicator with developed internal client consulting skills, the Candidate will be responsible for understanding vision and objectives of the Sponsor while proactively finding data-based solutions that lead the organization.

The Data Analyst provides support in analyzing data, providing insights and reports as it relates to various business operations, aggregating data to achieve data-driven insights and results. The Analyst is responsible for measuring and assessing the effectiveness of the data sets. The Data Analytics position deals with issues related to reporting, aggregating, combining multiple internal and external data sources to produce analyses, and metrics. The Data Analyst is also tasked with providing mentorship and guidance to the government team members and stakeholders.

Duties
Query and mine data resources to answer ad-hoc business questions.
Manipulating Data through visualization in Tableau
Starting with raw data and a business need or question, deliver high-impact analyses and presentations.
Identify and create new data resources from disparate sources to enable reporting, data science, and advanced analytics.
Understand business objectives and user needs to translate into requirements for reporting, analytics, and data science projects.
Create advanced reporting and dashboards primarily in Tableau and PowerPoint.
Leverage statistical testing and experimental design methodologies to determine impact of organizational actions.
Innovate data science-enabled resources including segmentations and predictive models
Qualifications:

Requirements
TS/SCI with Poly level clearance is required
BS and 10+ years of experience; Masters and 8+ years of experience; additional experience may be considered in lieu of a degree
Knowledgeable with Tableau and other data visualization tools and techniques
Create and maintain rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis, with reporting components from multiple data sources
Programming experience with frameworks, including Python & SQL
Must be a self-starter
Ability to translate complex concepts into clear, compelling “stand-alone” graphic products
Ability to manage complex projects and schedules with multiple objectives and priorities
Ability to work collaboratively with a broad range of stakeholders across organizational boundaries to accomplish mission goals
Ability to work under tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Peraton Overview:

Peraton drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world’s leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted and highly differentiated national security solutions and technologies that keep people safe and secure. Peraton serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies across the intelligence, space, cyber, defense, civilian, health, and state and local markets. Every day, our employees do the can’t be done, solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers.

Job Summary
As a Statistical Project Leader, you will provide statistical leadership and guidance for clinical studies in one or more indications and will be accountable for methodological and statistical aspects of clinical development or medical affairs plans and subsequent deliverables. Utilizing strong study management, interpersonal and communication skills, you will be expected to ensure productive collaborations with other functions, as well as with other statistical project leaders and in communicating with senior leadership. You will promote teamwork, quality, operational efficiency, and innovation, as also represent Biostatistics (or provide leadership) in scientific or technology working groups or cross functional initiatives.
Major Duties and Responsibilities
With minimal direction from the group head, direct statistical support and provide scientific leadership for one moderate project, one or several indications or a highly complex large study in Neurology late phase.
Be accountable for statistical aspects of late clinical development, studies and submissions activities (when applicable), including relevance to external stakeholders (e.g. regulatory authorities, medical journals) and scientific validity, according to internal standards and regulatory guidelines, and in compliance with SOPs.
Plan and track project activities, timelines, and resource use. Seek to optimize resource utilization through efficient and well-managed resource allocation and across projects or areas.
Provide justifications for planned resource needs, allowing for the capacity to respond to unscheduled increase in project workload as needed. Effectively utilize external groups, e.g. CROs or data monitoring committees (DMCs), as applicable.
Represent Statistics in regulatory meetings.
Act as statistical consultant within company, and provide technical guidance and mentoring to people working on the projects.
Contribute to process optimization and provide input to statistical standards.
Required Education/Experience
PhD/MS in statistics or related discipline with at least 6 years of pharmaceutical experience.
Broad experience in clinical development or post-marketing activities such as submissions, interactions with regulatory agencies or other external stakeholders.
Broad knowledge and good understanding of advanced statistical concepts and techniques.
Experience in Neurology therapeutic areas preferred.

Data Scientist - Healthcare


Position Description

Join this multifaceted organization as a Data Scientist!

The best version of us starts with You!

CGI seeks a highly motivated Data Scientist to join our organization of data engineers and data scientists who collect, store, process, and analyze huge sets of data. Your main focus will be applying machine learning (ML) and data mining techniques, performing statistical analysis, and building high quality analytic systems - deep learning, anomaly detection, natural language processing (NLP), recommendation systems, predictive analytics and information retrieval. You'll mentor teammates, develop algorithms and scripts, apply machine learning, and use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn that set of disparate data points into recommended and measurable insights.

This position is based in Lafayette, LA (Preferred) but can also be on-site in Bloomfield, CT

Your future duties and responsibilities

Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers/regressors using machine learning techniques.
Data mining using innovative methods - deep learning, learning to rank, anomaly detection.
Extending existing data with third party and open sources of information when needed.
Improving data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems.
Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis.
Perform analysis and proactive assessments of issues along with giving appropriate solutions.
Draft, refine and present machine learning foresight to business partners.
Crafting automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance.

Required qualifications to be successful in this role

At least 7+ years of overall experience in machine learning and data mining techniques.
Experience in machine learning (ML) techniques and algorithms, such as Boosting, k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, natural language processing (NLP) etc.
Experience in deep learning techniques - neural networks, Boltzmann machines, auto-encoders, etc.
Experience in using various model optimization techniques including Hyperparameter tuning, etc.
Experience with at least one of common data science and software development toolkits, such as Python, Spark, Scikit Learn, MLFlow, Git, etc.
Experience with any one of the following data visualization tools, such as Tableau, Dash, Streamlit, Power BI, Qlik, D3, etc.
Experience with integration of data from multiple data sources (on-premises databases, Lakehouse, etc.).
Experience with SQL Server databases.
Experience with Spark-SQL, MySQL, T-SQL.
Shown applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
Ability to interpret and communicate highly sophisticated model results and their business impact to senior leaders.
Exposure to Model Deployment and Maintenance techniques
Intermediate data migration skills for cross-platform databases (on-premises databases, Lakehouse, etc.).

Education: Master's degree preferred, or at least a bachelor's degree in computer science, Applied Mathematics/Statistics, Data Science, or Data Analytics.

Desired qualifications/non-essential skills:
Experience with cloud providers - Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure
Experience with Cloudera/MapR/Hortonworks/Databricks
